Ask your state legislators to promote fairness and justice in plea agreements by supporting HB 4149.

Dear ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

In Oregon, roughly 95 percent of criminal cases never make it to trial. The overwhelming majority of cases are resolved through plea agreements, but plea agreement negotiations do not have the transparency of trials.

Criminal defendants in Oregon are often required to waive a range of rights and even access to rehabilitation programs as a condition of plea agreements. In some cases, plea agreements have included the waiver of constitutional and procedural rights. This is profoundly unfair because it removes the checks and balances that our justice system needs.

Ask your state legislators to promote fairness and justice in plea agreements by supporting HB 4149.

Whether people are scared, confused, or getting bad counsel, they should not be presented with an offer to waive their rights to things like:

  • the right to challenge their conviction based on emerging evidence of innocence;

  • the right to request DNA testing of evidence; or

  • the right to programs designed to encourage rehabilitation and help put the lives of criminal defendants back on track.

Let your legislators know you support HB 4149 to stop the unjust waiver of rights in plea agreements.

Sincerely,

Kimberly McCullough
Policy Director
